text: Hurricane Sally was an Atlantic tropical cyclone. The storm threatened the United States Gulf Coast States of Alabama, Mississippi and Louisiana. Sally first developed near the Bahamas, moved over Florida, then became a tropical storm. Tropical storm and hurricane notices were put up from Louisiana to northwest Florida as Sally came toward the region. Several million people prepared for the hurricane. Others left the area. The storm later hit Alabama and northwestern Florida while a Category 2 hurricane. ==References== Category:Hurricanes in the United States Category:September 2020 events Category:2020 Atlantic hurricane season Category:Category 2 Atlantic hurricanes Category:Hurricanes in Mississippi
title: Hurricane Sally
